data.description:
A VR survival horror roguelike.

Trapped in a dying spaceship filled with horrors, you must explore, survive, and find your way back to the safety of Earth. Cosmodread features a rich, tense and immersive atmosphere that will make you forget about the world outside the headset.

EXPLORE: 
Search for resources and find a way home. Every run will have you play in a new procedurally generated layout, with random positions for rooms, corridors, items and hazards, and different emergent situations. You’ll never quite know what’s behind the next door.

SURVIVE: 
Use your own hands to interact with the environment. Open doors, drawers and lockers and rummage through their contents. Collect basic resources, and craft weapons and equipment to deal with both enemies and hazards.

FIGHT: 
Crouch behind cover and shoot at enemies with your crossbow, or set a trap for them to walk into. But remember: ammo is scarce!

changelog.change_log: - Fixed Options menu sometimes intersecting the main console in the introduction scene when playing seated
- Fixed crash caused when an enemy Cytoma wasn't able to find any objects to levitate or navigate to another room

- Fixed savegame loading error when the player had completed the coordinates objective
- Stability fixes for Crawler AI

- Fixed crash caused by an enemy spawning outside of the map's bounds
- Other minor bug fixes

- Fixed crawlers not always disappearing in lit rooms
- Updated engine and VR plugin versions for better stability
- bHaptics vest support is now disabled by default. You can still activate it in the in-game Options menu
- Improved bHaptics support with more feedback events

- Added support for bHaptics: TactSuit and Tactosy for Arms
- Fixed Railgun physics when dropping it after holstering another weapon
- Other minor fixes

- New weapon: Flamethrower
- New equipment: Map Beacon
- Added new room variations
- Added animated pulsing light to key cards
- Fixed inventory duplication issue
- Fixed trapmines not being properly saved after placing them
- Localization fixes
- Other minor fixes

- Quest 2: Increased framerate to 90Hz
- Quest 2: Fixed some environment textures using lower resolutions than they should
- Added audiovisual feedback when grenades are primed and about to explode
- Credits can now be skipped by holding the trigger button
- Increased Cosmonaut's speed and attack range
- Fixed minimap still displaying the level's map during credits and main menu scenes
- Fixed skybox not resetting when starting a new game
- Fixed jump sequence not updating the skybox in the windows of infested rooms
- Fixed bridge console also working when the bridge room had no power
- Added corrections to Italian localization
- Player will no longer be able to climp on the Courtyard's table
- Fixed Crawlers from sometimes jumping through room's walls
- Other fixes and corrections

- Fixed a few elements in some rooms that were using unoptimized shaders
- Fixed inventory sometimes becoming inoperative after placing specific items into it
- Fixed door key items from sinking into tables when spawning on specific positions
- Security fix

- Added new languages: Russian, Italian, Simplified Chinese, Japanese, Korean.
- Added "Random" option to randomly select modifiers to apply when starting the game.
- Improved minimap to work as expected with different orientations of the wrist / hand.
- Fixed infinite ammo exploit.
- When playing with the "Hive" modifier, the Fabricator will now have some energy already in it.
- Fixed trapmine floating in air when placed on the floor.
- Fixed Crawlers hidden inside lockers sometimes getting out too soon.
- Fixed Crawlers sometimes wandering into lit rooms.
- Added preventive measures for a number of issues.
- Other fixes and adjustments.

- Railgun: Increased damage multiplier for charged shots, reduced required time and ammo to charge a shot
- EMP grenade: Added damage to drones
- Teleporter grenade: Increased detection range when thrown at enemies
- Enemies can now be distracted by loud sounds also when actively chasing the player, as long as they haven't just seen you
- Fixed enemies sometimes spawning in invalid positions
- Fixed enemies being able to sometimes cross closed doors after a game load
- Fixed creatures not always disappearing when killed in a lit room
- Fixed drone spotlights remaining active after destruction
- Fixed lightning gun's sound getting stuck in a loop
- Added tentative fixes for some hard to reproduce issues
- Other fixes and improvements

- Added support for left handed controls (swaps controls between left and right hands)
- Fixed locked doors that were already open sometimes becoming permanently closed with the key in the lock after saving the game
- Fixed Lightning Gun's pump lever sometimes losing the hand interaction
- Fixed reaching out behind shoulder causing the direction of walk to reverse in smooth locomotion
- Fixed particle effects when using the teleporter with some enemies
- Fixed interaction detection for the escape shuttle's lever
- Fixed health indicator not refreshing after loading a saved game
- Fixed player being able to close doors while enemies were already crossing through them
- Fixed creatures sometimes spawning on top of the escape shuttle
- Fixed Crawlers being able to jump on to the forcefields covering hull breaches
- Fixed grenades causing other explosive items to detonate even through doors
- Fixed players falling into infinity if their headset went too out of bounds in the Intro scene
- Other minor fixes and improvements

- Fixed height not matching the real world (seated play is still possible from the new "Seated Mode" option in the Options menu)
- Quest 2: Added dynamic shadows. Increased resolution of some environment textures.
- Keys will no longer spawn in high shelves or inside closed lockers, where they were harder to see
- Keys will no longer receive force from explosions in their vicinity
- Locked doors will no longer become inoperable after being opened by the Cosmonaut
- Fixed monster kill count at the end sometimes displaying excessive numbers
- Improved accessibility of the Options menu from the wrist bracelet
- Players will no longer suffocate after they've triggered the escape sequence
- Improved health syringe detection range
- Changed Polypoid death tip text to something more useful
- Fixed geometry gaps in a corridor room
- Selecting the Exit option from the menu when in the Credits scene will now take you back to the Intro menu
- Other minor fixes and adjustments

NOTE: Runs saved with the previous version won't work after the update. Please switch to the "Old Version" branch if you want to keep playing a previous run. (This is only for saved runs, it doesn't affect blueprint or modifier unlock progression).

- Slightly increased smooth walk speed
- Added two more higher smooth rotation speeds
